intro: Descurainia glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular flax or sticky flax, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Descurainia glandulifera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and prairies.
